nodes.bodyText: @genryxy I think it's better to say that we are testing Gem repository rather then gem-adapter related classes

nodes.bodyText: @genryxy could you please explain how key is used? We build it from arbitrary data, but I do not see how this data is translated into user on server. Does the test fails if auth is enabled on server, but the key is not provided on push?

@olegmoz yes, it fails because the gem push expects that the gem server always requires credentials. Please, see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61384113/how-to-push-a-gem-without-auth I'll replace usr:pwd with any:any to make it little clearer.
@genryxy the name does not make much sense, why URL is with slash? Maybe urlwithuser or just url would be better?
@olegmoz in this case I want to show that this.url.string(anonymous) returns url with slash and request looks like POST /my-gem//api/v1/gems HTTP_1_1. So, I take substring of urlwithslash
@genryxy but this.url contains these slashes. How calling string method on this.url transforms it into URL with slashes (adds slashes)?
@genryxy exactly my point, it does not add slashes. Then why code reads "apply method string to this.url with parameter anonymous and get URL with slashes as result`, does it make sense?
